text: :This article uses Spanish naming customs: the first or paternal family name is Ngua and the second or maternal family name is Akeng. Jesús Lázaro Owono Ngua Akeng (born 1 March 2001) is a Spanish-raised Equatorial Guinean footballer who plays as a goalkeeper for Tercera División club San Ignacio and the Equatorial Guinea national team. ==Early life== Owono was born in Bata and moved to the Basque Country, Spain during his childhood. He joined Antiguoko at age 8. He represented the Basque Country at under–16 level. ==International career== Owono, at the age of 17, received his first senior call up by Equatorial Guinea in September 2018. He made his debut on 25 March 2019, playing all the second half of a 2-3 friendly loss to Saudi Arabia. ==References== ==External links== * Category:2001 births Category:Living people Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Equatoguinean footballers Category:People from Bata, Equatorial Guinea Category:Fang people Category:Equatorial Guinea international footballers Category:Equatoguinean emigrants to Spain Category:Naturalised citizens of Spain Category:Spanish footballers Category:Basque footballers Category:Spanish people of Equatoguinean descent Category:Real Sociedad footballers Category:Deportivo Alavés players Category:Tercera División players Category:Antiguoko players
title: Jesús Owono
